intro: Symplocos apolis, commonly known as the smoothleaf beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are smooth on both sides. It produces small, clustered white flowers in the spring, followed by bright purple berries in the fall. These berries are an important food source for various bird species.
